decks.notes: This deck focuses on the Aggro strategy, aiming to quickly overwhelm the opponent with an aggressive approach. The key concept of the deck is to utilize the Affinity mechanic, which allows for cost reduction and increased efficiency when playing artifacts. The deck includes numerous cheap artifacts such as Ornithopter, Gingerbrute, Frogmite, and Myr Enforcer, combined with cards like Springleaf Drum and Galvanic Blast to generate early board presence and deal damage. Thoughtcast provides card draw, while All That Glitters enhances the power of creatures. The deck also includes various land and bridge cards to support the artifact theme.

The key concept of this deck is to control the opponent's actions and board presence through disruption and removal spells. It aims to gain advantage through card draw and resource generation, utilizing cards like Ichor Wellspring and Lembas. Additionally, the deck includes finishers like Avenging Hunter and Thorn of the Black Rose to close out the game. The golgari color combination allows for a mix of removal, graveyard interaction, and token generation. The deck aims to maintain board presence through Khalni Garden and utilize powerful control elements like Crypt Rats and Spinning Darkness to maintain control over the game.

The key concept of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain board control. It achieves this by using a combination of removal spells like Echoing Decay, Agony Warp, Chainer's Edict, and Suffocating Fumes to deal with threats. The deck also includes countermagic like Counterspell to counter the opponent's spells. It aims to draw cards and filter through the deck using Preordain and Brainstorm. The deck's win condition is to generate value with cards like Murmuring Mystic and Ninja of the Deep Hours, and finish off the opponent with efficient creatures and damage spells.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by using a mix of removal spells and disruptive cards, while generating card advantage through sacrificing and drawing cards. The deck focuses on using cards that give value when sacrificed, such as Ichor Wellspring and Deadly Dispute. It also includes various removal spells like Defile and Cast Down to deal with opponent's threats. The deck aims to keep the board under control and gradually grind the opponent down, while also having some threat creatures like Avenging Hunter and Crypt Rats to close out the game.

The key focus of this deck is the aggressive, fast-paced playstyle commonly associated with the "Red Deck Wins" archetype in the Pauper 1 vs 1 format. The main deck features a combination of low-cost creatures such as Goblin Tomb Raider, Monastery Swiftspear, and Voldaren Epicure, alongside powerful direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt and Chain Lightning. The deck also utilizes cards like Goblin Bushwhacker and Kuldotha Rebirth to quickly amass a strong board presence. The inclusion of cards like Experimental Synthesizer and Implement of Combustion further enhances the deck's ability to deal damage efficiently.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize a combination of card flickering and card advantage to gain control of the game. This is achieved through a variety of cards such as God-Pharaoh's Faithful, Sunscape Familiar, and Mulldrifter to generate value. The deck also includes bounce spells like Ephemerate and Ghostly Flicker to allow for repeated card flickering and to trigger enter-the-battlefield effects. Meeting of Minds and Brainstorm provide further card draw and manipulation. The deck aims to create a strong board presence while disrupting the opponent's strategy through counterspells and removal.

This deck focuses on the combo strategy of flickering creatures and spells to generate value and card advantage. The key concept is to continuously flicker powerful creatures like Mulldrifter and Sea Gate Oracle using cards like Ephemerate and Ghostly Flicker. This allows you to repeatedly enter the battlefield and draw extra cards, while also triggering abilities and generating tokens with cards like Murmuring Mystic. The deck also includes counterspells like Prohibit and Essence Scatter to protect your combo pieces, while utilizing card selection and mana fixing with Preordain and Merchant Scroll.

The key concept of this deck revolves around generating card advantage and controlling the game through removal spells and discard effects. The deck aims to prolong the game and outvalue the opponent with cards like Reckoner's Bargain and Ichor Wellspring, while also utilizing efficient removal spells like Cast Down and Defile to deal with threats. It also features a strong sacrifice theme with cards like Deadly Dispute and Fanatical Offering, allowing the player to get additional value from their creatures. Overall, the deck focuses on resource management and attrition to outlast the opponent.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to achieve a fast and aggressive playstyle with efficient creatures and burn spells. The deck focuses on efficient creatures like Thraben Inspector, Seeker of the Way, and Glint Hawk to quickly develop a board presence and apply pressure. It also includes cards like Relic of Progenitus to disrupt graveyard strategies and Lembas to generate additional value. The deck utilizes burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Blast to both remove threats and close out games. The mana base includes various color-producing lands to ensure consistent and smooth mana development.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on using a combination of creatures and spells to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategies. The deck includes Faerie Seer, Augur of Bolas, and Spellstutter Sprite to provide early board presence and disruption. Ninja of the Deep Hours allows for card advantage and recurring creatures. The deck also includes efficient removal spells like Snuff Out and Cast Down to deal with threats. Counterspells like Counterspell and LÃ³rien Revealed help protect your permanents and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The goal is to maintain control of the game and out-value the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to use control elements combined with the Gates mechanic to create a strong defensive strategy. The deck includes a combination of cheap creatures like Sacred Cat and Squadron Hawk to provide early defense, along with control spells like Counterspell and Journey to Nowhere to deal with opponent's threats. The Gates mechanic is utilized through cards like Citadel Gate and Sea Gate to create additional defensive options. The deck also includes card draw and selection effects like Brainstorm and Preordain to ensure consistent access to resources. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while creating a resilient defense.

The core idea of this deck is to control the game using a combination of creatures and counter spells while utilizing the power of gates. The deck aims to stall and disrupt the opponent's plans through cards like Counterspell and Journey to Nowhere. It also incorporates creatures like Sacred Cat and Squadron Hawk to provide board presence and defense. The Gate cards, such as Citadel Gate and Azorius Guildgate, are used to enhance the deck's synergy and enable strategic mana usage. The deck relies on smart card selection and careful planning to outlast and outplay the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using cheap and efficient creatures like Goblin Tomb Raider, Monastery Swiftspear, and Voldaren Epicure. The deck also includes a variety of burn spells like Lightning Bolt, Galvanic Blast, and Lava Dart to finish off opponents and eliminate threats. The deck focuses on affordability and speed, utilizing cards like Implement of Combustion, Experimental Synthesizer, and Reckless Impulse to generate card advantage and maintain pressure. The mana base consists of mainly Mountains and Great Furnaces to support the aggressive playstyle.

The main concept of this deck is to generate a large number of small, cheap artifacts, and then use them to quickly build a powerful board presence. The deck takes advantage of the Affinity mechanic, which reduces the cost of spells based on the number of artifacts you control. This allows you to quickly deploy threats like Myr Enforcer and Moon-Circuit Hacker, while also using cards like Metallic Rebuke to counter your opponent's plays. Additionally, the deck includes cards like All That Glitters and Razortide Bridge to boost the power and toughness of your creatures, allowing for quick and efficient kills.

The key concept of this Dimir Control deck is to maintain control over the game by using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy and maintain a dominant board presence through efficient removal spells like Cast Down and Agony Warp. Card advantage is achieved through spells like Brainstorm and Ponder, while also utilizing efficient creatures like Spellstutter Sprite and Ninja of the Deep Hours to maintain tempo. The inclusion of LÃ³rien Revealed and Snuff Out allows for additional removal options, adding flexibility to the control strategy.

The key concept of this deck is to create a powerful combo by repeatedly flickering (removing from and returning to the battlefield) key creatures and spells. This combo is enabled by cards like Ephemerate, Ghostly Flicker, and LÃ³rien Revealed. By flickering creatures like God-Pharaoh's Faithful, Sunscape Familiar, and Archaeomancer, the player can gain life, reduce spell costs, and recur important spells. The deck also includes card draw and counterspells to provide additional control and consistency. The land base includes various options for color fixing and utility.

The key concept of this Golgari Garden control deck is to maintain control of the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy by using removal spells like Snuff Out, Spinning Darkness, Cast Down, Defile, and Deadly Dispute. The deck also aims to generate card advantage and gain life through cards like Tithing Blade, Ichor Wellspring, and Blood Fountain. It utilizes creatures like Thorn of the Black Rose, Troll of Khazad-dÃ»m, Avenging Hunter, and Crypt Rats to maintain board presence and pressure the opponent. The deck also includes utility lands like Haunted Mire and Witch's Cottage to support its strategy.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game using removal spells and efficient creatures while generating card advantage through sacrificing artifacts and creatures. The deck aims to remove opponents' threats with spells like Snuff Out, Cast Down, and Chainer's Edict, while also playing efficient creatures like Guildsworn Prowler and Avenging Hunter. It utilizes cards like Crypt Rats and Deadly Dispute to generate additional value by sacrificing artifacts and creatures. The deck also includes defensive lands like Bojuka Bog to disrupt opponents' graveyard strategies and gain an advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to create a powerful combo by utilizing flicker effects. The deck includes cards like Augur of Bolas, Archaeomancer, and Ardent Elementalist, which can be flickered to generate additional value. The flickering is achieved through cards such as Ephemerate, which allows the player to exile a creature and return it to the battlefield, triggering their enter the battlefield effects multiple times. This combo can be further enhanced by cards like Mulldrifter and Murmuring Mystic, which provide card draw and token generation respectively. The deck also includes a mix of removal spells, countermagic, and lands to support its game plan.

The key focus of this deck is to aggressively attack the opponent using low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Voldaren Epicure, and Goblin Tomb Raider. This is supported by cards like Goblin Bushwhacker and Experimental Synthesizer that can create additional creature tokens. The deck also includes a mix of burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Chain Lightning to deal direct damage to the opponent's creatures or directly to their life total. The goal is to quickly reduce the opponent's life total to zero through a combination of creature attacks and burn spells.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of low-cost creatures, backed by burn spells. The deck focuses on utilizing cheap and efficient creatures like Goblin Blast-Runner, Monastery Swiftspear, and Goblin Bushwhacker to apply early pressure. Additionally, it includes burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to both control the board and deal damage directly to the opponent. The deck also features some sacrifice effects with cards like Kuldotha Rebirth and Goblin Grenade to maximize damage output. The deck's mana base consists mainly of Mountains supported by Great Furnace for additional mana acceleration.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive red creatures and spells. The deck focuses on playing low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Voldaren Epicure, Goblin Bushwhacker, and a specific unnamed goblin, which are supported by spells like Lightning Bolt and Wrenn's Resolve. The deck also includes cards like Lotus Petal and Experimental Synthesizer to ramp up mana quickly. Kuldotha Rebirth provides additional creature generation, while Reckless Impulse helps with card draw. The deck utilizes the Seal of Fire and Great Furnace for additional burn damage. Overall, the key concept is to establish early board dominance and deal quick damage to the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using low-cost creatures and burn spells. The deck is built around cards like Monastery Swiftspear, Voldaren Epicure, and Kessig Flamebreather, which can deal immediate damage and put pressure on the opponent. It also includes burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Blast to deal direct damage to the opponent or kill creatures. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Implement of Combustion and Experimental Synthesizer to provide additional value and card draw. The deck aims to win the game by attacking relentlessly and overwhelming the opponent with its fast and efficient creatures and burn spells.

This deck focuses on utilizing low-cost creatures, such as Faerie Seer, Faerie Miscreant, and Snaremaster Sprite, to quickly establish a board presence and apply pressure to the opponent. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Spellstutter Sprite and Counterspell to maintain control over the game. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Ninja of the Deep Hours and Moon-Circuit Hacker allows for card advantage and additional damage. Supporting spells like Mutagenic Growth and Spell Pierce provide protection and disruption as well. The deck is heavily centered around the use of blue creatures and spells, with a solid mana base of Islands.

The main concept of this Aggro - Red Deck Wins deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent's life total. It achieves this by utilizing cheap and efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Thermo-Alchemist, and Kessig Flamebreather. The deck also includes burn spells such as Lightning Bolt, Lava Dart, Searing Blaze, Fireblast, and Chain Lightning to deal direct damage to the opponent. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Experimental Synthesizer and Reckless Impulse to help maintain card advantage and keep the pressure on the opponent.

The key idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. The deck focuses on low-cost creatures and efficient card draw to maintain a steady stream of threats. It also includes a mix of removal spells and combat tricks to control the board. The inclusion of equipment enhances the power of the creatures, making them more difficult to deal with. The deck is built around the synergy of white weenie creatures and spells, creating a cohesive game plan that aims to quickly and efficiently defeat the opponent.
